#summary DB connector configuration form field values for different databases

== Introduction ==

Following fields on the DB connector configuration page are dependent on which DB your connector needs to be configured:

 
1. JDBC Connection URL

2. JDBC Driver Classname
 


== Details ==

Here are the typical values used for different databases for these fields:


*MY SQL server:*
 

Driver Jar Used:mysql-connector-java-5.1.6-bin.jar 

1. JDBC Connection URL: jdbc:mysql://DB_HOST_NAME_OR_IP:3306/#_Database_Name

The Database_Name is the name of database schema in which the table used in select query resides. 

2. JDBC Driver Classname: com.mysql.jdbc.Driver
 

*MS SQL server 2005:*
 

Driver Jar Used:sqljdbc.jar

1. JDBC Connection URL: jdbc:sqlserver://DB_HOST_NAME_OR_IP:1433;databaseName=Database_Name

The Database_Name is the name of database schema in which the table used in select query resides. 

2. JDBC Driver Classname: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver
 

*Oracle:*
 

Driver Jar Used: ojdbc14.jar

1. JDBC Connection URL: jdbc:oracle:thin:@DB_HOST_NAME_OR_IP:1521:Database_Name

The Database_Name is the name of database schema in which the table used in select query resides. 

2. JDBC Driver Classname: oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver
 

*IBM DB2:*
 

Driver Jar Used:db2jcc.jar

1. JDBC Connection URL: jdbc:db2://DB_HOST_NAME_OR_IP:50000/Database_Name

The Database_Name is the name of database schema in which the table used in select query resides.  

2. JDBC Driver Classname: com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver
 
 

*Notes:*

1. Ports used in the JDBC connection URLs above are the default Database installation TCP/IP ports. These may differ if user has custom installation.

2. For JDBC driver jars and driver class names refer: http://www.dbvis.com/products/dbvis/doc/supports.jsp
